The appellant appealed the decision and sought determination as to the extent to which s.25 of The Saskatchewan Farm Security Act protects the debtor from an action on the personal covenant to pay a balance owing for mortgage taken in part to secure the purchase price of farmland. The Court found that the decision in Andrew (CA) was somewhat unusual in these circumstances, as this Court did not avert in Andrew the previous ruling in favour of the appellants. The appeal was allowed and the court reviewed the decisions of the chambers judge and the decision of the Bank of Montreal. The court concluded that the determination of the proper amount of deficiency judgment was determined by the Court of Appeal. It was instructive to note that the appellant respects the spirit and intent of the LCCRA and is the correct interpretation to be placed on that provision. The order below should be varied to entitle the respondent to take out a deficiency judgment against the appellant in the amount amount of $31,160.23.
